title: Summarise Cohort Variables
description:
Capture a classroom snapshot by assigning the requested values to four variables and printing a labelled summary.

Steps:
1. Assign `students = 28`, `averageGrade = 91.5`, `highestGrade = 'A'`, and `labOpen = true` using appropriate C++ types.
2. Use `std::boolalpha` before printing `labOpen` so the boolean appears as `true`/`false`.
3. Output the four labelled lines exactly as shown below, one per line, in the same order.

Expected output:
Students: 28
Average grade: 91.5
Highest grade: A
Lab open: true

tests.name: prints labelled summary
tests.expected:
Students: 28
Average grade: 91.5
Highest grade: A
Lab open: true

hints: Assign the exact values: 28 students, average grade 91.5, highest grade 'A', lab open true.
Use std::boolalpha before printing the boolean so it shows true/false instead of 1/0.
Print each line with std::cout << label << value << std::endl;
